trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Drery is faced with a nigh unfathomable conundrum.
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_TODO_00<tab>Solve the riddle in the will.
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_TODO_01<tab>Deliver the dainty wooden chest to Drery.

TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_SYSTEM_000_000<tab>Should you choose to undertake this quest, you will receive no guidance from the journal or the duty list. You will need to read the text carefully and decipher the clues to determine your next course of action.

TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_001<tab>If you've got a moment, let me tell you about a friend of mine. She was a hard worker, but her real passion was for riddles, head-scratchers, and the like. Until she met her end at the hands of a right horrible sin eater. Phronesis, I think they called it.
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_002<tab>Anyway, like a lot of miners, my friend kept a will. But she couldn't write a nice, simple one the same as everyone else, oh no.

TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_003<tab>It said that she'd buried something and that if we wanted to find it, we'd have to solve a conundrum. Trouble is, none of us can work it out. But I thought someone like you, with an outsider's perspective, might see something we hadn't.
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_004<tab>It goes like this:
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_005<tab>"On road leading afar, follow to the third star, Fear not the fall, look to the Wall, At the first dry giant's heel, the brave wanderer must kneel."

TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_006<tab>I can't make head nor tail of it, to be honest. Still, we're dying to know what she's buried, so if you have any luck, be sure to tell us. Oh, and I wrote down the riddle, in case you forget.
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_SYSTEM_100_006<tab>Use Drery's note to read the riddle again.
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_010<tab>"On road leading afar, follow to the third star, Fear not the fall, look to the Wall, At the first dry giant's heel, the brave wanderer must kneel."
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_011<tab>Not the sort of thing most folk would write as their last will and testament, I'm sure you'll agree.
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_MEMO03510_100_011<tab>"On road leading afar, follow to the third star, Fear not the fall, look to the Wall, At the first dry giant's heel, the brave wanderer must kneel."
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_SYSTEM_000_020<tab>You discover a small chest buried beneath the sand!
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_040<tab>I can't believe you found it!
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_041<tab>Let's see what's inside...
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_042<tab>Coins, rings, even an expensive-looking pocket knife. This must be what she raked in from all those card games!
TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_043<tab>Wait, there's a letter. “This is for Twine,” is all it says.

TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_044<tab>Come to think of it, I knew she made a killing on the cards, but I never saw her spending much of her winnings. Seems she was putting them away to give back to the town after her death, almost like she knew it was coming.

TEXT_LUCKZG025_03510_DRERY_000_045<tab>Always was a mystery, that one. It's funny, I never realized how much I miss her until now. Not only have you solved the riddle, but you've shown me what sort of person she really was. You have my thanks.
